Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near To The Espanya Metro Stop”
Reviews.Author: Muldr4Scly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 10-15 minutes walk from the Espanya metro stop. You can find the hotel by walking down Gran Via de Les Corts Catalanes (past the Ayre Hotel) and turn left on Carrer d’Indibil street. Something to note - Google has not positioned this hotel in the right location. Google has positioned it on the corner of street Carrer de Sant Pere d’Abanto. This is incorrect as the hotel is located on the corner of the following street. I had forgotten to request a high-up room and was given one on the ground floor. I did not experience any problems with noise and would not have known I was on the ground floor or that I was only a few doors away from the Reception desk! My hotel room was split into two areas. The first area (when you walk in) had a sofa, desk and table. There was a kitchenette area along one wall. I did not use this so cannot comment. The second area past the kitchenette contained a huge bed and a door off to the bathroom. The bathroom had a big double shower and was a nice size. The windows had shutters rather than curtains which were great at blocking out light. The room was practical and clean. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: James K
Reviews.Content: The BCN Montjuic is a great apartment/hotel complex. The bedrooms were very nicely decorated and clean and tidy, bathroom was superb and to top it all off, you got a nice little kitchenette into the bargain too! Just a few minutes walk from the Placa de Espanya, it is close to Metro links across the city, so if you're not bothered about being right in the city centre then this place is ideal. It is also really close to the Olympic Park which was great to look around.

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean and cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: manos_lianopoulos
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from 5 January up to 9 January 2012. It is a quiet and clean hotel, with beautiful small apartments and friendly staff. The only disadvantage was that we had to walk about 15 minutes up to the metro station, which was a problem at night while returning from city center and after a few drinks. The hotel isn't in the center of Barcelona (4 metro stations away), and we liked that because we saw another area of the city that we wouldn't see it if we have chosen to stay at the center. The Montjuic park just behind the hotel, is one of the most beautiful areas to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Modern short stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: rir_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a group of students while on an educational tour. Several students were grouped in the hotel's "apartments". They were incredible! The kids kept asking me how much it would cost to live in an partment like this after college...little do they know they probably couldn't afford it, ever. The rooms were modern, spacious, and well-equipped. Apartments even had a washing machine and dishwasher!

Reviews.Title: “No value for money, unprofessional staff, worst choice we made”
Reviews.Author: Ninnadj
Reviews.Content: The inconvenience with this hotel started already during booking. We were given various information about the availability of the rooms and eventually had to book two nights that were not convenient for our schedule at all. Since we already payed for this and could not get a refund, we had to agree. Upon arrival to the hotel, the receptionist seemed quite distracted, without any hospitality manners. He did not even say "welcome". We were given a twin room with separate beds, even though we have booked a double bed. We were told there are no double beds, however it seemed many rooms were not occupied in the hotel. I needed to use internet to send an important document and the hotel's connection was down. Even though wifi was included in the booking fee, the receptionist offered us to use another connection in the hotel for a certain fee (or go to a nearby internet cafe). Customer service slacking from a second receptionist already. Eventually, after the receptionists switched shifts, the new one had no information about internet connection being down and gave ma the password. The room was small, clean at first sight, but not so much when you take a closer look. The room design is quite weird, because the toilet is right in the middle of the room,quite near to the bed; meaning the toilet seat is about 3 meters from your pillow, separated by thin glass. We do not recommend this hotel as it is not worth the money we paid (even with discount) and there are plenty of other hotels in Bcn with better quality and service. With the service this hotel is providing, it seems very unlikely for them to survive in an environment with better standard competition. Hopefully the hotel management can get useful information from this website and work on their hotel issues.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, minimalistic and yet comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: ArtemDiogtiev
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to spend a night in the hotel that surprised us in a pleasant way - unusual design but yet comfortable ans pleasant to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Brian D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first night of our honeymoon in Europe. We were expecting a new, clean, small hotel room. It was spot on, like it was straight out of an IKEA catalog. Cheaply constructed (I'm an architect) but it's not a permanent residence, so no big deal. Close to the Olympic Park and Montjuic, but far from the tourist attractions (waterfront, Las Ramblas, and Guadi's architecture) along with the better dining. Had to walk too far for good restaurants, but again that was expected. As with anything, as long as you know what to expect, it's a great deal. Clean hotels in Europe are difficult to find, and they're almost always small - Americans tend to have a hard time understanding that. Only real negative about this hotel other than a distant location from the city center was the front desk staff - they didn't speak any English, or Italian for that matter. - seasoned traveller w/ 6+ months of backpacking in Europe experience

Reviews.Title: “they do not respect the children policy”
Reviews.Author: diana c
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay in this hotel, because I could not agree with them over the children policy. I tried to booked a triple room and told them we were 4, the 4th person being my younger daughter (4 yr old), but we didn't ask for an extra bed. Although on the booking site they said a child this age stay free of charge if using the existing bedding, they actually did not accept the four of us. They told us we should pay an extra charge for the 2nd child, no matter if we want or not an extra bed for her. Of course we refused their 'offer' and booked in another hotel (with which actually we had the same issue, but finally solved it) and now we are looking forward to go and see Barcelona. I think this could be helpfull when you try to make a booking in this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mila_Milk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Just 10 minutes from Plaza España, with easy access to the airport and around the city. Good clean rooms. There are a few downsides. Hot food at breakfast could be "hotter" in all the rooms are very thin walls. The double room instead of one double bed, two bed shifted on the wheels. such beds divergent from each other during sleep xD. And if you're going to Barcelona in winter, cold tile floors in the rooms, not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms - the food is another story”
Reviews.Author: KT-BRT
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is it's best feature - only a couple of blocks walking to Plaza Espanya where the metro line runs, and to the Art Museum, fountains and up the hill to the Olympic sites. We found walking around to be safe and easy, even in the evening. Nice public areas, a small rooftop patio made it easy for others in our group to sit outside and enjoy a cocktail in the evening. The rooms are large and well equipped. The only problem I had with my room was that it was non-smoking, but when I checked in it was quite obvious that the guest before me was not a non-smoker. There was not much I could do but open the windows to try and air it out. I talked to the front desk and they offered to come spray a deodorizer but I was worried that the smell of the deordorizer plus the smell of smoke would be too much. Others in our group complained of smoke coming into their non smoking rooms from surrounding rooms when they had their windows open. The biggest problem with the hotel was the food. Our group had breakfast and dinner two nights. The first night I explained to the staff, in Spanish, that I'm vegetarian (which would have also been communicated ahead of time by our group tour guide), and they had a non meat alternative for me, which was fine. The second night there weren't any dishes without meat. When I asked the server about the vegetarian meal, she shrugged her shoulders and walked away. I had a piece of bread and went down the street to find a cafe. The breakfasts were also limited, bruised fruit and greasy sausage. Overall, the location makes it a good choice, just don't plan to eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - central, inexpensive, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: alfonso_massa
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - it is 5 minutes walk from Piazza Espagna, well linked and has friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are very clean and modern. They also have a kitchenette so you can do some self- catering, if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: bazik_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in January 2011. There room is big enough for 3 people. There is small kitchen in the room so you can cook meals. The hotel is situated about 20 min walk from Playa Espana. There are lots of caffe around where you can get breakfast. There is small swimming pool at the roof. During summer time it should be nice to spend some time near the pool.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: silvia85_11
Reviews.Content: the hotel is great, the staff is the best, very helpfull, they gived us the ways to get to the principal atraction of the city and more informations. the rooms are large and confortble, the kitchen have somes acessories, it's not very far to the metro station, about 500 meters of espanha place station. they are some mini-markets close to the hotel. the hotel have internet, a living room for all the guest with tv and snooker table. the city is easy to visit from this point of barcelona, transports are all close, airportbus, bus, metro,bikes... i loved to stay there, i recomend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable oasis with self catering facilities”
Reviews.Author: celticwarriorCardiff
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here. The rooms are very clean and fairly big. The kitchen area is great for storing cold drinks and for those who want to save money by buying @ near supermarkets. The area is absolutely fine and full of locals. It isn't intmidating at all. Its a 10 minute walk to espana metro and the driop off for the airport express. in my opinion for the price its great value. I have been to barcelona 16 times.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for short citybreak”
Reviews.Author: jklak
Reviews.Content: I spent there only one night after 2 weeks on Costa Daurada. It's a appropriate hotel for short citybreak, but with intensive sightseeing, as the rooms are not too suitable for sitting there - there are no windows to the outside world, only to inside corridors. But if you spend the whole day in the city it doesn't matter. Rooms are quite spacious with kitchenette and a couch with table, where you can eat. Hotel is located just a few walking minutes from the Font Magica and the rest of Montjuic. It's also not a problem to get to public transportation, just a 100m from Gran Via. Not far from the airport. The staff spoke very little English, but was extremely helpful - we left Barcelona on the day of the General Strike with everything not working but they managed to find a taxi for us!

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the center for a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SushiDeLuxe_1974
Reviews.Content: A 15 min. walk away from the Plaça Espanya where the airport express stops and a main metro station is situated. Ramblas, harbour etc. aren't far away using the metro, but too far by feet. We only stayed for one night here and had to take the airport express early in the morning, but for a whole citytrip, the hotel is not well located. There's a seperate kitchen, good if you stay for longer and want to cook. Free wifi didn't work on the iPhone, but it did on the netbook.

Reviews.Title: “Was well impressed until the cleaner stole my Jeans!!”
Reviews.Author: islandstyle_10
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights the the Motel and found the studio unit I was allocated, modern, clean tidy and quite spacious with a large shower. The t.v was in Spanish but I wasnt here to watch t.v so it didnt bother me. This place is very quiet even to the point of not seeing another guest until breakfast (which was cold meats and a wide selection of breads, fruit juice and croissants all yummy but no hot food) which was great for me as after a day of bbusy sightseeing it was nice to come home to peace and quiet. The reception staff were friendly and all was going great until my checkout day...I had put my luggage into reception holding and about 2o mins later realised I had left a pair of jeans on a shelf in the room. I went straight back to reception to let them know as I knew the cleaners were still working and would have done my room and found my jeans(expensive pair at that otherwise wouldnt have bothered!) immediately I was given a blank look by reception ( a girl) and when I repeated myself slowly she understood and rang the cleaners...No, they are not to be found in the room was what I was told and that was the end of that as far as they were concerned. I wasnt happy, emptied my suitcase in front of reception to prove I did not have them and the continued to ignore me!! I apologise for the lenght of this review but I was going to give them a huge thumbs up..unfortunately stealing makes it a big "fail" for me. This is not good enough and something has to be said. Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money, clean and in good area”
Reviews.Author: Ionika_9
Reviews.Content: very good area-10min to Magic Fountains, good connections around-metro and bus, cleaned our room every day, very usefull kitchinette with appliances and some cuttlery for free; quiet area, everything working.. :) would return there

Reviews.Title: “Service sucks-Extremely poor location”
Reviews.Author: ygrealtor
Reviews.Content: We knew we were in trouble when 3 taxi drivers had no idea about this hotel and had trouble locating it. Upon arrival, we were immediately disappointed as to location and the total lack of ammenities. No lounge/restaurant. No place to simply get a cup of hot water for tea. Wireless internet was sketchy at best. Breakfast was a true disaster/disappointment. I am not sure why they bother to offer anything at all. Front desk staff needs to be retrained as to customer service and should be multi-lingual. The beds were very uncomfortable and we had to inquire at the front desk twice to simply get the room cleaned and new towels. The rooms were fashionable overall though. This is the poorest location I have ever experienced for a hotel in my many years of travel for business or pleasure. It was a chore to get dressed and walk a few blocks simply for a cup of hot water or a simple snack. There is a neighborhood restaurant directly accross the street with extremely limited hours and is closed on sunday all day. The food is horrible and processed but you can enjoy a soda or a pastry without travelling too far. The kitchen in the room is a total joke. It consist of 2 plates and no silverware. They had the nerve to desire extra payment for the fitness center when that is the only amenity they offer! I would never suggest this hotel to anyone for any reason whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, lovely atmosphere, would without a doubt come back!!”
Reviews.Author: cocoxannie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and myself stayed at Montjuic for a week, and got back on the 18th, the hotel staff were very helpfull, and polite. The hotel itself is immaculate, and the cleaners visited daily to change the towels, scrub down the room and even wash dishes. The mini kitchens that come in the rooms are great! and saved us alot of money on food, as niether of us were fans of paella! also great little bar literally accross the road from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, and you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: travelfamilyTulsa_OK
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was sparse, but acceptable. We stayed for 4 nights, and the cleaning gradually became less and less. Three adults in the room, paying a triple rate and we were getting only one towel by the end. In addition, the front desk staff was surly and unhelpful. In fact, we had a tour scheduled for Sunday. On Saturday, I went to the front desk to get directions to the meeting place. The front desk attendany begrugingly found the location on the city map. We arrived at the meeting place early the following morning but no one else came. Well, there was a "spring forward" time change in Spain (three weeks AFTER the US) and the hotel staff negelcted to tell us.

Reviews.Title: “Modern,clean and ok situated for the price.”
Reviews.Author: kattborg
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and modern with the reception open 24 hours a day. The apartment was spacy and clean. Strange however that the cupboards were absolutely empty - no forks, no plates, no saucepan, no nothing except for two glasses. Ok breakfast until we got MOULDY bread!!! We asked ourself, if the bread is old what else is? We lost our apetite. If it hadn´t been for the mouldy bread (unforgivable) we would have recommendended this hotel because of the price and how it was situated.

Reviews.Title: “Not cleen enough”
Reviews.Author: sima2maria
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel 7 day , and the housekeeping did not aspirate in our room, also in the lobby.( the carpet is very dirty) .In the secound day i asked for a blanket ,because in the night is cold ,but i get 1, after 2 days,and the big surprise was in the next , in evening when i come in my room i found that blanket is missing. Is normal to be 2 blanket in a twin room, because are 2 beds ?!!! The breakfast is from 07.00 until 09.00,at 09.01 begin to gather , to mature while we eating ..etc . Some receptionists doesn't speak english , is not possible in 2010 !!! Unfortunately i must say , i will not recommend to other tourists .

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel One can Get”
Reviews.Author: wafergozo
Reviews.Content: I went on a trip to Barcelona with my friends. The location is excellent just 10 mins walk to Placa Espagna which is a main square with metro and buses. Along the street to Placa Espagna one can find supermarkets , bazaars and restaurants which were very usefel. The rooms in the hotel were AWESOME. We had a spacious kitchen as well as a spacious bedroom with a bathroom. A Very modern looking hotel which fascinated me.! Room was cleaned everyday (towels , beds) . The Hotel is very secure as it has cameras outside of all windows and the outside is locked. (Opened on request). The staff helped us to order take away food as well as booking taxis and going to attractions. The breakfast was awesome too. !

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You pay For”
Reviews.Author: magicparrot
Reviews.Content: The Montjuic was clean, quiet and good value. It is a strange dark place, stark, modern and tucked away out of sight and out of mind. If you MUST go to Barcelona, this hotel is OK. But if possible- AVOID BARCELONA IF YOU CAN. IT IS FULL OF THOUSANDS OF PICKPOCKETS AND MUGGERS and you WILL be robbed.

Reviews.Title: “nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonE7
Reviews.Content: good location 10 min walk to espanya metro station and accessible to the montjuic area and all the major sights in barcelona from the espanya station. they dont allow you to check in until 2pm but they have a luggage storage room. the room was very nice with flat screen tv. there is a fridge mini stove and a living room area to use a laptop. no cutlery or plates are provided so you will have to bring your own. the room has shutters to keep out the sun which can make it like a bunker with no sunlight if you need to get up early. the shower is a glass room in the centre of the room so not much privacy if more than one person. there are convenience stores on the main street if you need to buy supplies. also internet cafes on the main street and banking atms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Very Modern - Not central however”
Reviews.Author: dickiedog
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights end of June. Arrived quite late after getting a cab from Sants Station cost around 12 euro. Staff sorted out room in no time and even supplied us with extra pillows. Place clean and tidy no kitchen utensils was aware of this before hand. Suprised by Irish couples remarks. Found the staff helpful no restrictions on swimming pool. If yo are IT minded you will love the place wifi points everywhere and free of charge check this out first there was no charge whilst we were there. You will not get accommodation in the city centre for the price of this hotel booked with Bookings.com Only problem showers whilst being flash run hot then cold. About ten minutes walk to Plaza Espanya Metro which takes you into the city. Buy the 10 journey on the metro works out a lot cheaper than sigle fares. Be warned Barcelona is like any other city expensive. Have been to Barcelona many times and still love it. Try a little Catalan the locals like it.

Reviews.Title: “Be better if some small improvements made...”
Reviews.Author: Gonelocal
Reviews.Content: 3 day stay in June. Location as noted by others is out of the main centre of Barcelona, but easy access to public transport, and simple to find from airport side of town, off the main Gran Via. Arrived with car - the hotel has underground car parking, but were advised this was fully booked. However full marks to the front desk for 'finding' a space and this was a great help - on street parking is available, pay until 18.00, free overnight, (but no apparent spaces anywhere near the facility, so suggest pre-book the hotels spaces - €15 per day fee). Apartment offered was on ground floor, road side - the alternative is courtyard side. As the building fits the site on a steep slope behind the hill of Montjuic, this meant as others note that the rooms are very dim as the road side part of the building and has screens against the traffic. There is a seating area outside the room with table and chairs provided - but this is behind the screens, so the space has no 'daylight' and is dingy and not attractive - never even considered sitting there. The criticsm of the accommodation sounds worse than the quality and value for money - one broken window pane, nothing offered in the kitchen area apart from two glasses - but fridge, microwave oven and sink installed - shower head was broken so the spray was always against the wall, sink coming off the wall, one bedside light not working, aggressively bright ceiling lights, but a depressing colourway of grey walls and mushroom coloured furniture meant the appearance is not inviting. Broken seat back on one chair. Towels that won't dry you off and only 3 coat hangers in the wardrobes....come on guys, spend €5 a room and get some more please! Most irritating aspect was an emergency light in the room over the door that stays on 24 hrs - so the room is lit all night long, albeit that light is dim! Note the courtyard facing rooms are open to the public space leading to the breakfast room, so though they have full daylight, these are not particularly in a 'private space'. The better side of things - the beds are comfortable, sheets very crisp and clean. Breakfast (though it closes at 9.00 a.m.) is a buffet of cereal, pastries, yoghurts, coffee, fruit juice and toast / preserves. Roof top pool and sun deck is definitely available to all guests - not only the residents of the on-site apartments staying long term but hotel guests too (A tip - on check out, we requested the use of the pool later in the day before leaving for the airport, and for a small key deposit this was free to use. Handy option if you have a late flight or want to have some sun and space in town before travelling on). Small mini market a short walk away has the essentials, and all of Barcelona is easy to reach using the public transport. NB - buy a multi-pass ticket for the buses and Metro which saves a lot of hassle with small change. I'd recommend the hotel of you can book in plenty of time and get the best price - €39 a night paid (...which was fine taking the negative points and I hope there is a replace and repair programme to get the place back to a good condition - it isn't that old a building, and as part of a chain, if the owners want business in their other locations, they will lose out if the BCN Montjuc is the first example of their business...) but rate went to €90 closer the date of arrival - not worth that higher price though I'm afraid. Good as a place to fall asleep after a days' sightseeing, and staff are pleasant and attentive, so I can recommend it, but it does need a sprucing up. As for Barcelona - excellent destination for food, sightseeing and a place to wander around!

HotelInfo.Name: BCN Montjuic Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: San Fructuoso 64-74, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
